intro: Elaphoglossum cuspidatum, commonly known as the slender holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sori, which are clustered on the underside of the fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Elaphoglossum cuspidatum is native to regions of the Americas, including parts of the southeastern United States.
